alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 12:37PM CST until March 05 at 2:34PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN MARSHALL...CENTRAL JACKSON AND DEKALB COUNTIES... At 1237 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Stevenson to near Section, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Scottsboro, Fort Payne, Boaz, Rainsville, Henagar, Stevenson, Crossville, Sylvania and Fyffe. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CST for northeastern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
